snippet: Horacio Cartes, the presidential front-runner, compared gay people to “monkeys” and support for same-sex marriage to believing in the “end of the world.”
abstract: Horacio Cartes, presidential front-runner in Paraguay, sets off fierce controversy after publicly disparaging gay people and same-sex marriage.
lead_paragraph: Horacio Cartes, the presidential front-runner, compared gay people to “monkeys” and support for same-sex marriage to believing in the “end of the world.”

headline.seo: Candidate in Paraguay Stirs Controversy With Remarks on Gay Marriage
headline.main: Candidate Disparages Gays in Paraguay, Stirring Dispute
headline.print_headline: Candidate Disparages Gays In Paraguay, Stirring Dispute

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
